sen.j: 印岐志呂神社（いきしろじんじゃ）は、滋賀県草津市片岡町に鎮座する神社である。
sen.e: Ikishiro-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Kataoka-cho, Kusatsu City, Shiga Prefecture.
Ikishiro-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Kataoka-cho, Kusatsu City, Shiga Prefecture.
Ikishiro-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Kataoka-cho, Kusatsu City, Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 天智天皇の時代に創祀されたという。
sen.e: It is believed that Ikishiro-jinja Shrine was first enshrined in the Emperor Tenchi era.
It is believed that Ikishiro-jinja Shrine was first enshrined in the Emperor Tenji era.
sen.cmt: 宮内庁HP記載に従い、天智天皇（てんじてんのう）：Emperor Tenjiとしました。
sen.e: It is believed that Ikishiro-jinja Shrine was first enshrined in the Emperor Tenji era.

sen.j: 延喜式神名帳に記載の式内社である。
sen.e: This shrine counts among Shikinai-sha (higher-ranked shrines) listed under "Engishiki Shinmyo Cho" (Jinja shrines' list under the Engishiki [an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers]).

This shrine counts among Shikinai-sha (higher-ranked shrines) listed under "Engishiki Shinmyo Cho" (Jinja shrines' list under the Engishiki [an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers]).

This shrine counts among Shikinai-sha (higher-ranked shrines) listed under "Engishiki Shinmyo Cho" (Jinja shrines' list under the Engishiki [an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers]).

sen.j: 社伝によると、仁寿元年に正六位の神階を受けたという。
sen.e: According to the shrine's biography, the rank of Shorokui (Senior Sixth Rank) was conferred on the deity of this shrine.
According to the shrine's biography, the rank of Shorokui (Senior Sixth Rank) was conferred on the deity of this shrine.
According to the shrine's biography, the rank of Shorokui (Senior Sixth Rank) was conferred on the deity of this shrine.

sen.j: 建武 (日本)3年、高師直と比叡山との合戦の際戦場となったり、織田信長による六角氏攻めでの戦場になるなど、度々の戦禍にさらされた。
sen.e: This shrine was frequently damaged by wars; for instance, it became battlefields when KO-no-Moronao and his troops fought a battle with armed priests of Mt. Hiei in 1336, and when Nobunaga ODA attacked the Rokkaku clan.

This shrine was frequently damaged by wars; for instance, it became battlefields when KO no Moronao and his troops fought a battle with armed priests of Mt. Hiei in 1336, and when Nobunaga ODA attacked the Rokkaku clan.
sen.cmt: ハイフンを外し、KO no Moronaoとしました。
sen.e: This shrine was frequently damaged by wars; for instance, it became battlefields when KO no Moronao and his troops fought a battle with armed priests of Mt. Hiei in 1336, and when Nobunaga ODA attacked the Rokkaku clan.

sen.j: 明治9年に郷社、大正6年に県社に加列した。
sen.e: It was designated as a Gosha (a village shrine) in 1876, and then a Kensha (a prefectural shrine) in 1917.
It was designated as a Gosha (a village shrine) in 1876, and then a Kensha (a prefectural shrine) in 1917.
It was designated as a Gosha (a village shrine) in 1876, and then a Kensha (a prefectural shrine) in 1917.
